author: Winston Churchill
content: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
Forgiveness is that subtle thread that binds both love and friendship. Without forgiveness, you may not even have a child one day.
author: George Foreman

content: The friendship that can cease has never been real.
author: Jerome

content: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.
author: Mother Teresa

content: The best thing in every noble dream is the dreamer...
author: Moncure D. Conway

content: One friend in a lifetime is much; two are many; three are hardly possible. Friendship needs a certain parallelism of life, a community of thought, a rivalry of aim.
author: Brooks Adams

content: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
author: Pablo Picasso

content: He who fears being conquered is sure of defeat.
author: Napoleon

content: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
author: Isocrates

content: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
author: Jerome

content: Humanity is acquiring all the right technology for all the wrong reasons.
author: Buckminster Fuller

content: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

content: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Yeah, we all shine on, like the moon, and the stars, and the sun.
author: John Lennon
Aesop
content: It is with our passions, as it is with fire and water, they are good servants but bad masters.
In the sky there are no tracks. Outside there is no recluse. There are no conditioned things that are eternal. There is no instability in the Buddhas.
author: The Buddha
Winston Churchill
content: The truth is incontrovertible. Malice may attack it, ignorance may deride it, but in the end, there it is.
I want my friend to miss me as long as I miss him.
author: Augustine of Hippo

content: God always takes the simplest way.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Friendship is also about liking a person for their failings, their weakness. It's also about mutual help, not about exploitation.
author: Paul Theroux
Heywood Broun
content: Sports do not build character. They reveal it.
Friendship is an arrangement by which we undertake to exchange small favors for big ones.
author: Montesquieu
The Buddha
content: Irrigators channel waters; fletchers straighten arrows; carpenters bend wood; the wise master themselves.
The differences between friends cannot but reinforce their friendship.
author: Mao Zedong
Mark Twain
content: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

content: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
author: Albert Camus

content: Love is the master key that opens the gates of happiness.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

content: I will not be concerned at other men's not knowing me; I will be concerned at my own want of ability.
author: Confucius
Babe Ruth
content: You just can't beat the person who never gives up.
An invincible determination can accomplish almost anything and in this lies the great distinction between great men and little men.
author: Thomas Fuller

content: To lead people walk behind them.
author: Laozi

content: Knowledge has three degrees: opinion, science, illumination. The means or instrument of the first is sense; of the second, dialectic; of the third, intuition.
author: Plotinus
Woody Allen
content: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream; not only plan, but also believe.
author: Anatole France

content: The only Zen you find on the tops of mountains is the Zen you bring up there.
author: Robert M. Pirsig

content: If it is not right do not do it; if it is not true do not say it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
author: Thomas Hobbes

content: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
author: Epictetus

content: People are so constituted that everybody would rather undertake what they see others do, whether they have an aptitude for it or not.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: You can stand tall without standing on someone. You can be a victor without having victims.
author: Harriet Woods

content: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca the Younger

content: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
author: Bruce Lee

content: A prudent question is one half of wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

content: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
author: Plutarch

content: Wise men talk because they have something to say; fools, because they have to say something.
author: Plato

content: A house divided against itself cannot stand.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: I cannot always control what goes on outside. But I can always control what goes on inside.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: Nature takes away any faculty that is not used.
author: William Inge
